definition: dawn/morning/daybreak/day/dan, female roles in Chinese opera (traditionally played by specialized male actors)
Dante Alighieri (1265-1321), Italian poet, author of the Divine Comedy 神曲
if only it were so/I hope so (idiom)
Gdansk, city on Baltic in north Poland
lit. not aiming to achieve the best possible result, but rather trying to avoid making mistakes (idiom)/fig. to take a risk-averse approach
pinyin: bu4 qiu2 you3 gong1 , dan4 qiu2 wu2 guo4

definition: Tennyson (name)/Alfred Tennyson, 1st Baron Tennyson (1809-1892), English poet
there is no harm in saying what one thinks (idiom)
variant of 撒旦[Sa1 dan4], Satan or Shaitan
variant of 約旦|约旦, Jordan

sentences.english: But as a local born and bred Liverpudlian person.
sentences.chinese: 但作为一名土生土长的利物浦人。

sentences.english: While it was a great day, I got a bit sunburned in the water.
sentences.chinese: 今天过得很棒，但我在水里把自己给晒伤了。

sentences.english: The big boys jumped into the river but little Ned hung back.
sentences.chinese: 大些的男孩子都跳进河里了，但小内德畏缩不前。

sentences.english: The assembling process is complex for fitting way, but it has a high assembling accuracy.
sentences.chinese: 修配法装配过程复杂，但装配精度高。

sentences.english: We have only two double rooms available but they are on different floors.
sentences.chinese: 我们只剩下两间双人房，但在不同的楼层。

sentences.english: Jack subdues the suspect but realizes Hampton has been shot.
sentences.chinese: 杰克制服了嫌犯，但他发现杰西被子弹击中了。

sentences.english: The book was out of print, but I eventually ran it to earth at a secondhand bookshop.
sentences.chinese: 那本书已经绝版，但我终于在一家旧书店淘到了它。

sentences.english: She tries to back track, but the President simply walks away.
sentences.chinese: 她试图重新回到话题，但总统一言不发地走开了。

sentences.english: But it was this sense of failure that made him determined to succeed in his new life.
sentences.chinese: 但就是这种失败感使他决心在新的生活中取得成功。
穿着有吸引力但不挑逗。

sentences.english: But sometimes, ISP's and mail service businesses have no interest in righting what went wrong.
sentences.chinese: 但有时，互联网的业务和邮件服务没有兴趣纠正想歪。

sentences.english: But in the third week of May, currents drew some of the oil southeast.
sentences.chinese: 但到了5月的第三周，洋流开始把浮油带向东南方向。

sentences.english: Yeah, but scented tea is now in fashion.
sentences.chinese: 是的，但现在的时尚是喝花茶。

sentences.english: Although solitary accessory spleen is not uncommon, multiple accessory spleens are rare.
sentences.chinese: 虽然单一性副脾并非不常见，但多发性副脾仍属少见。

sentences.english: But the Dallas-based carrier isn't just looking at Boeing.
sentences.chinese: 但这家总部位于达拉斯的承运商不仅仅只是眷顾波音。

definition: despite/although/even though/in spite of/unhesitatingly/do not hesitate (to ask, complain etc)/(go ahead and do it) without hesitating
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
also/too/(in Classical Chinese) final particle implying affirmation
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
